title: How to help high schoolers prepare for the rise of artificial intelligence
summary: MIT Abdul Latif Jameel Clinic for Machine Learning in Health (Jameel Clinic) organized a summer program to educate high school students about the use of AI in healthcare. The program aimed to reach students from diverse backgrounds and offered courses such as "Intro to Python" and "Intro to Clinical AI." The program was made possible through a generous gift from the AI for Humanity Foundation, reducing financial barriers for under-resourced students. The students had the opportunity to interact with MIT faculty and learn about the intersection of computer science and medicine. The program emphasized collaboration and innovation in science and healthcare.
